summary:
Anthrax is a rare but serious infection caused by a bacterium. You can get it from contact with infected animals or their products. There are three main types: skin, inhalation, and intestinal. Symptoms vary, but can include sores, fever, and breathing problems.

It's most common in Africa and Asia, with a few cases in the U.S. each year. Treatment with antibiotics is crucial, as it can be deadly. Anthrax has also been used as a biological weapon.
title: Anthrax
